item.title:
Sloth's claws work the opposite way that human hand does. The default position is a tight strong grip, and sloths must exert effort to open them up. This is why sloths don't fall out of trees when they're asleep
[read more: https://t.co/dljU1Z7DFB] https://t.co/ErXF3xWC2j

item.title:
One cannot just "solve the AI alignment problem." Let alone do it in 4 years.
One doesn't just "solve" the safety problem for turbojets, cars, rockets, or human societies, either.
Engineering-for-reliability is always a process of continuous & iterative refinement.

item.title: With dropping applications, 60% of submissions streamlined, and relative Zoom disengagement, most of the @CIHR_IRSC Project Grant action falls onto the vagaries of the three main reviewers. I think this makes funding decisions suboptimal.

item.title: Panels need more time to discuss more grants; they need to build rapport. The discussion needs to matter more. I think some panels should be merged, less grants should be streamlined, and meetings should move back to in person.
